error.signature: TypeError: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()
error.regex: TypeError: object of type '(\w+)' has no len\(\)

verdict.summary: Calling len() on an object that doesn't support it. Usually None from a function that returns nothing.

dead_ends.why_fails: Usually the variable is wrong type, not missing __len__
Hides the root cause — variable shouldn't be None

workarounds.action: The variable is probably None — check function that assigns it (many list methods return None)
workarounds.how:
# Bad: my_list = my_list.sort()  # .sort() returns None!
# Good: my_list.sort()  # sorts in place

workarounds.action: Add None check before calling len(): if obj is not None: len(obj)
workarounds.how: if obj is not None: len(obj)
